title: Govt under pressure to announce Sri Lanka’s stand in case of Indo-Pak war
byline: The government is under pressure from the opposition to declare Sri Lanka’s position in the event of further escalation of tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Veteran singer Saman De Silva passes away
byline: Veteran singer Saman De Silva, a renowned and much-loved Baila artist, has passed away at the age of 69, family sources confirmed.

title: Acting IGP assigns Police team to support probe into Tennakoon
byline: The Acting Inspector General of Police has appointed four officers, including an Assistant Superintendent of Police from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), to assist the three-member committee investigating the suspended Inspector General of Police, Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: Court bans protest near exam centres
byline: The Maligakanda Magistrate’s Court issued an order prohibiting several individuals from entering or remaining near examination centres where competitive exams are being held today (April 27) for graduate recruitment to supplementary health service courses.

title: Huge blast at key Iranian port kills 14 and injures more than 750
byline: At least 14 people have been killed and 750 injured in a massive explosion at one of Iran’s key ports, authorities say.

title: IMF reaches staff-level agreement with Sri Lanka on fourth review
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) announced today that it has reached a staff-level agreement with the Sri Lankan authorities on the Fourth Review of the country’s economic reform program under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

title: President pledges international cricket stadium to north
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said an international cricket stadium will be constructed in the north.

title: Titanic survivor’s letter sold for £300,000 at auction
byline: A letter written by a Titanic passenger days before the ship sank has been sold for a record-breaking £300,000 ($400,000) at auction in the UK.

title: Images of Pope Francis’ tomb released
byline: Images of Pope Francis’ tomb at the Santa Maria Maggiore church in Rome have been released.

title: Man falls to death off 60-foot pole while acting Hindu cultural drama
byline: A man who demonstrated the main character of a drama (Ponnan Sangar), which depicted the Hindu culture, fell to death off a 60-foot pole in Nanu Oya this morning.

title: Kandy faces disease risk after Tooth Relic exposition
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ Union has warned that Kandy is at risk of spreading serious infectious diseases because the city cannot handle the large number of people coming for the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic.

title: Nine people killed after car plows into crowd at Vancouver Filipino festival
byline: A driver plowed a car into a crowd at a street festival celebrating Filipino heritage in Vancouver on Saturday night, killing at least nine people and injuring others.

title: Treasury will earn highest ever revenue in 2025: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today that the Treasury will record 2025 as the highest ever revenue generating year in Sri Lankan history.

title: Sri Lanka not ready to host SAG 2026 – NOCSL
byline: The 15th South Asian Games (SAG) in 2026 is in doubt due to the current political crisis between rivals India and Pakistan.

title: Five injured in lightning strike at Basawakkulam Lake
byline: Five people were admitted to the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital after being injured by a lightning strike while bathing in the Basawakkulam Lake, the Anuradhapura Headquarters Police said.

title: Moldovan tourist drowns in Habaraduwa Hotel pool
byline: A 36-year-old Moldovan national who was staying at a tourist hotel in Liyanagoda, Habaraduwa died after drowning in the hotel’s swimming pool, the Habaraduwa Police said.

title: Gradual increase in 2024 A/L pass rate: Exams Dept.
byline: The Examinations Department today announced that the pass percentage of the 2024 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) Examination has shown a gradual increase compared to previous years.

title: Kandy MC labourers given special opportunity to worship Sacred Tooth Relic today
byline: Steps have been taken to provide a special opportunity for the labourers of the Kandy Municipal Council, who continuously engaged in the cleaning of Kandy city, to venerate the Sacred Tooth Relic today.
